## Discrepancies in the linear model predict epistatic relationships

Lets first look at known epistatic relationships, that we know to exist in the dataset:

for example: FUS1, and AGA1 should be activated when HOG1, and PBS2 are inactive in Salt.



![Salt Example](img/HOG_PBS_RESID.png)

### residual profiles cluster into functionally enriched modules:
<!-- (so do the coefficients from before?) -->

Define clusters:
```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(magrittr)
#library(Rtsne.multicore)
library(amap)

load('../../input/images/model_parameters.RData')

full_shrunk = full
full_shrunk[abs(full_shrunk)<2] = 0
fs_dist = Dist(full_shrunk, method = "euclidean", nbproc = 20)
#hc = hclust(fs_dist)
#cutree(hc, h=12)
fsd_matrix = as.matrix(fs_dist)
fsdm_similarity = fsd_matrix<14
diag(fsdm_similarity) = 0

g = graph_from_adjacency_matrix(fsdm_similarity, mode = 'undirected')
fg = fastgreedy.community(g)
mem = membership(fg)
clusters = tibble(Gene = names(mem), cluster = mem)
clusters %<>% left_join(t2g)
cluster_location = '../../output/residual_clusters'
dir.create(cluster_location)

clusters %>%
  add_count(cluster) %>%
  filter(n > 1) %>%
  group_by(cluster) %>% 
  do(
    write(pull(.,name), 
          file = paste0(cluster_location,
                        '/cluster_',
                        as.character(unique(.$cluster)), 
                        '.txt')
          )
    )
```

*  MEME/Scope

So after running meme, lets look at two of the clusters:
Cluster 7, that holds FUS1 and AGA1:

```{r}
this_cluster = clusters %>% filter(cluster == 7)
knitr::kable(this_cluster)
shiny::includeHTML("../../../memeTest/residual_clusters/cluster_7/ame.html")
this_cluster_resid = apply(full[this_cluster$Gene,],2,mean)
tibble(Exp = names(this_cluster_resid), val = this_cluster_resid) %>% 
  separate(Exp, c('Condition', 'Strain'), sep = '_') %>% 
  mutate(Condition = relevel(factor(Condition),ref = 'YPD'), 
         Strain = relevel(factor(Strain),ref = 'WT')) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x=Strain,y=Condition, fill = val)) + 
  geom_tile() + scale_fill_gradient2() + theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 1))
```

and lets pick one other randomly:

```{r}

```


### Error modules (groups of error profiles) reveal Known classes of epistatic relationships
<!-- Class 1 -->
The linear model assumes that Kinase identity and Condition identity make independent contributions to gene expression.  

1. If a Condition's effect propagates through a inhibition given Kinase, then the linear model will overestimate gene expression for that Condition-Kinase pair  
    * HSP12 on Salt + PKA (Get GD?)
2. If a Kinase's activity is required to correctly regulate a gene's expression in a condition specific manner, the linear model will badly estimate that condition specific interaction (as there is no term to correct for such a fine tuned response)
	  * Mating pathway  

INSPIRE Cluster 36 (Contains FUS1 and other mating genes)
